posts.post_content: You could also play [Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth ) on turn 1, then this card and [Vampire Hexmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Hexmage ) on turn 2. With [Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth ) in play, You'd be able to treat Dark Depths as a swamp.

posts.post_content:
[Wrath of Marit Lage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of Marit Lage) and [Curse of Marit Lage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Curse of Marit Lage) are very odd.
  
   
Found this on wikipedia:
  
   
Marit Lage
  
   
A powerful sorceress (sorceress of wrath), worshiped by some as a god. She was imprisoned deep within the ice covering Dominaria. The image for "Dark Depths" (Coldsnap) pictures her avatar as a massive Kraken-like creature beneath the ice, and the art for the token produced by Dark Depths shows her as a shadowy, many-tentacled monstrosity, dwarfing the person put in the art for scale. She was not a planeswalker, but did have the ability to travel between planes via another method.
  
   
   
and there is a token for her.
  
   
http://www.wizards.com/Magic/Magazine/Article.aspx?x=mtgcom/arcana/1119

Posted By: Malnourished_Student (2/16/2010 5:43:33 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I collected a few of these because it was the only Legendary Snow Land in existence, and that was cool. I'm still happier about that than I am about the Hexmage combo (awesome, but hard to pull off, and not my style).  
  
One reason I like the Hexmage combo: it's too fragile to be broken. Creatures get exiled or bounced routinely in Legacy, so it'll never overwhelm the field of decks. It's just a cool option for rogue play, and makes the range of possible opponents more interesting! :)
posts.html:
I collected a few of these because it was the only Legendary Snow Land in existence, and that was cool. I'm still happier about that than I am about the Hexmage combo (awesome, but hard to pull off, and not my style).

One reason I like the Hexmage combo: it's too fragile to be broken. Creatures get exiled or bounced routinely in Legacy, so it'll never overwhelm the field of decks. It's just a cool option for rogue play, and makes the range of possible opponents more interesting! :)

posts.post_content:
A special honor goes to Marit Lage for being what I believe is the beefiest creature with a determined amount of power and toughness. Sure, creatures with X/X and other growing abilities can get even bigger, but in terms of already determined power you just don't go above 20.  
  
And isn't it just awesome that this thing can make a snack out of [Emrakul, the Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul, the Aeons Torn)?  
  
(Okay, fine, there's the Big Furry Monster with 99/99 but that's Unhinged/Unglued)
posts.html:

posts.post_content: I found this card and decided it would be fun to have one on hand. I went out and bought one for $16 at my local game store. I was just thinking to myself, "20/20, legendary, INDESTRUCTABLE...but wait...what about chump blockers?" So I came here to rate this a 4/5 but just as I was about to solidify my position, I came upon this one little word, "flying". Yeah, flying kraken. Woot. 5/5.

Posted By: Arachnos (7/27/2012 8:50:40 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
So when I first saw this land, I was like, "Ooh, a nice icy lake with a big imposing shadow ON TOP of the ice, and it makes a giant black monster card! Neat ^\_^"...And then I realized that the monster was actually BELOW the ice looking UP at the surface, and I immediately became overcome by my crippling fear of fantastical watery leviathans.  
5/5 for being just so wonderfully full of flavor, and for scaring the crepes out of me.
